description: 10th order Patalan numbers (generalization of Catalan numbers).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
W. Lang, On generalizations of Stirling number triangles, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 3 (2000), #00.2.4.
T. M. Richardson, The Super Patalan Numbers, arXiv preprint arXiv:1410.5880, 2014
formula: G.f.: (11-(1-100*x)^(1/10))/10.a(n) = 10^(n-1)*9*A035278(n-1)/n!, n >= 2; 9*A035278(n-1)= (10*n-11)(!^10) = product(10*j-11, j=2..n). - _Wolfdieter Lang_Conjecture: n*a(n) +10*(-10*n+11)*a(n-1)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 28 2014a(n) = 100^(n-1)*pochhammer(9/10, n-1)/n! for n >= 1.  Maple confirms this satisfies Mathar's conjecture for n >= 2 (it's not true for n=1). - _Robert Israel_, Oct 05 2014
